TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ConsoleNode extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents the basic structure used for the Console menu.

remarks.para: Each object can optionally have child ConsoleNode objects and associated console objects. Action user interfaces such as the Editing menu, Quick Access button, or Site Actions menu present various actions to the user. Each of these has an instance of the object that provides a hierarchical collection of ConsoleNode objects. Some ConsoleNode objects implement the ConsoleAction class in a specific way.
When the property for a ConsoleNode is defined as a ConsoleAction, the properties of the ConsoleAction, such as and , are used as properties with the same names in the ConsoleNode.

When a property, such as , is defined in both a ConsoleNode object and a ConsoleAction object that the ConsoleNode references, the value specified in the ConsoleNode overrides the value in the referenced ConsoleAction if the corresponding Boolean value has been set. In this case, setting the property to false causes the ConsoleNode to override the ConsoleAction property.

Each instance of this class represents an action or a submenu. For example, in the Site Actions menu, if a ConsoleNode has at least one child in the ChildConsoleNodes collection, it appears as the root of a submenu with the child ConsoleNodes appearing in the submenu. If the ConsoleNode has no child objects, it appears as a clickable action.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of a object with the specified ConsoleNode as its no parent.

remarks.para: Because this ConsoleNode object is the parent, it is also the root node.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.WebControls.ConsoleNode nodeParent) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of a object that has a parent node.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the access key of this object.
Docs.value: The access key of this object.

remarks.para: Some controls, such as the PublishingMenu, allow a ConsoleNode to have an that can be used as the top-level menu.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable Property Action As ConsoleAction

public: virtual property Microsoft::SharePoint::Publishing::WebControls::EditingMenuActions::ConsoleAction ^ Action { Microsoft::SharePoint::Publishing::WebControls::EditingMenuActions::ConsoleAction ^ get(); void set(Microsoft::SharePoint::Publishing::WebControls::EditingMenuActions::ConsoleAction ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the object that corresponds to this object.
Docs.value: The object that corresponds to this object.

remarks.para: Use this property to associate a ConsoleAction object with a ConsoleNode object to include this ConsoleAction in the user interface. When a ConsoleAction is referenced, the following properties of the ConsoleAction propagate to the ConsoleNode properties with the same names:

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Attributes As NameValueCollection

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of all properties pertaining to this object.
Docs.value: A NameValueCollection of all properties pertaining to this object.

remarks.para: When extra properties are defined in the console XML that are not defined as properties of the ConsoleNode object, for example, they appear in this collection with all other standard properties.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ ChangedNodeId { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.ChangedNodeId : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the identifier (ID) of the object being replaced, modified, or deleted.
Docs.value: A string representing the original ID of a ConsoleNode object.

remarks.para: The string representing the original ID of a ConsoleNode object may be modified.

When you use the ConfigMenuOptions.Replace, ConfigMenuOptions.Modify, or ConfigOptions.Delete options, you must specify both the property of the being modified or deleted and the ID of the new node. These two IDs must be different.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property ChildConsoleNodes As ConsoleNodeCollection

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of ConsoleNode objects that are child objects of this object.
Docs.value: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable Property ConfigMenu As ConfigMenuOptions

public: virtual property Microsoft::SharePoint::Publishing::WebControls::ConfigMenuOptions ConfigMenu { Microsoft::SharePoint::Publishing::WebControls::ConfigMenuOptions get(); void set(Microsoft::SharePoint::Publishing::WebControls::ConfigMenuOptions value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets how this object is used with the existing hierarchy.
Docs.value: A property value representing the meaning of this ConsoleNode object in the context of the existing hierarchy.

remarks.para: You can add ConsoleNode objects to an existing collection, replace an existing node, or represent the deletion of a node in the collection. The ConfigMenu property value represents how this ConsoleNode should be interpreted.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Description { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Description : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a string containing text that describes this object.
Docs.value: A string containing text that describes this ConsoleNode.

remarks.para: Some user interface elements allow for a description to appear as part of each action. When this is true, SharePoint Server 2010 uses this text.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ DisplayText { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.DisplayText : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the display text associated with this object.
Docs.value: The string representing the display text for this ConsoleNode.

remarks.para: This property has the same behavior as the ConsoleNode.Text property.

Public Overridable Property Enabled As Boolean
public: virtual property bool Enabled { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.Enabled : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets whether the object should be enabled for the user.
Docs.value: A Boolean value representing whether this ConsoleNode should be enabled or disabled for the current user.

remarks.para: You should not set this property directly. Whether the node is enabled is determined dynamically by the object when it is evaluating the current context.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property HasChildNodes As Boolean
public: property bool HasChildNodes { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a Boolean value that indicates whether this object has any child ConsoleNode objects.
Docs.value: A Boolean value representing whether this ConsoleNode has one or more child nodes.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool HideIfDisabled { get; set; }
Public Overridable Property HideIfDisabled As Boolean
public: virtual property bool HideIfDisabled { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.HideIfDisabled : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets whether this object should be hidden from view when it is disabled.
Docs.value: A Boolean value representing whether this ConsoleNode should be hidden if it is disabled.

remarks.para: Some actions are best hidden any time they are disabled, although the default is to show disabled actions. Setting this property to true hides the action when it is disabled due to the current context.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable Property HideStates As List(Of AuthoringStates)

public: virtual property System::Collections::Generic::List<Microsoft::SharePoint::Publishing::WebControls::AuthoringStates> ^ HideStates { System::Collections::Generic::List<Microsoft::SharePoint::Publishing::WebControls::AuthoringStates> ^ get(); void set(System::Collections::Generic::List<Microsoft::SharePoint::Publishing::WebControls::AuthoringStates> ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the states for which this object should be hidden.
Docs.value: An object value representing what states should be set to true for this action to be hidden.

remarks.para: In some objects, disabled objects are displayed in the user interface by default. In specific instances, a ConsoleNode should be hidden instead of disabled. For example, when the page is checked out, CheckOutAction can be hidden because it will never be enabled in that context.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Id { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Id : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the identifier (ID) of this object.
Docs.value: A string that represents the unique ID of this ConsoleNode.

remarks.para: Every ConsoleNode on a page must have a unique ID.

public: virtual property System::String ^ ImageUrl { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.ImageUrl : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the URL of the image shown when this is used.
Docs.value: The URL of the image that is displayed when this ConsoleNode is used.

remarks.para: In some user interface elements, an icon is shown as part of the action. This value is the URL for that image.
This value overrides that of a referenced object when property is set to false.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool IsCurrentlyEnabled(valuetype Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.WebControls.AuthoringStates currentState) cil managed
Public Overridable Function IsCurrentlyEnabled (currentState As AuthoringStates) As Boolean

abstract member IsCurrentlyEnabled : Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.WebControls.AuthoringStates -> bool override this.IsCurrentlyEnabled : Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.WebControls.AuthoringStates -> bool

Docs.param: A bitmask of AuthoringStates representing the current state of the page.
Docs.summary: Specifies whether the object should be enabled or disabled without being restricted to what is defined in the enumeration.
Docs.returns: The rights mask representing the required rights.

remarks.para: This value overrides that of a referenced ConsoleAction when the property is set to false.
In some situations, a bitwise AND of AuthoringStates is not adequate to define exactly when an action should be enabled. In this case, you can use this method to define the Boolean return value.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool IsSeparatorImage { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.IsSeparatorImage : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets whether this object is a separator of other items.
Docs.value: A Boolean value representing whether this ConsoleNode is a separator.

remarks.para: Some user interface elements allow for a ConsoleNode to be inserted into a hierarchy, which results in a separator image between sections.
Setting this property to true creates the separator image.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool IsSiteRelative { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.IsSiteRelative : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets whether to interpret the property as relative to the current object.
Docs.value: A Boolean value indicating whether the NavigateUrl property should be interpreted as relative to the current SPWeb.

remarks.para: A typical use for this property is when Console XML references static URLs to pages in the _layouts directory.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual int MenuGroupId { get; set; }
Public Overridable Property MenuGroupId As Integer
public: virtual property int MenuGroupId { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.MenuGroupId : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the group identifier (ID) in which this item should be displayed.
Docs.value: An integer representing which group should contain this object.

remarks.para: Some user interface elements (UI) have a mechanism to use this value to divide ConsoleNode objects into separate groups. Those with the same value all appear in the same group.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string NavigateUrl { get; set; }
Public Overridable Property NavigateUrl As String
public: virtual property System::String ^ NavigateUrl { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.NavigateUrl : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the href value of this object.
Docs.value: Either a URL for navigation or ECMAScript to be executed when this ConsoleNode is clicked.

remarks.para: When a user clicks a ConsoleNode on the page, this property determines how the browser responds. If a conventional URL is specified here, the user is directed to that page. If ECMAScript is specified, the browser executes the script. Users can include script to post back to the same action to save the current page.
The value of this property overrides that of a referenced object when the property is set to false.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ OriginalId { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.OriginalId : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the original identifier (ID) of this ConsoleNode before an associated action modifies it.
Docs.value: A string representing the original ID of a object before it is modified.

remarks.para: This property is used to maintain consistency internally between ConsoleNode objects and associated objects.
Setting this property is usually unnecessary.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::SharePoint::Publishing::WebControls::ConsoleNode ^ ParentNode { Microsoft::SharePoint::Publishing::WebControls::ConsoleNode ^ get(); void set(Microsoft::SharePoint::Publishing::WebControls::ConsoleNode ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the parent ConsoleNode of this object.
Docs.value: The parent ConsoleNode, or a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) if this is the root.

remarks.para: Other than the root ConsoleNode, every ConsoleNode must have a parent in the hierarchy. This property makes it easier to traverse the hierarchy both up and down.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable Property PermissionContext As PermissionContext

public: virtual property Microsoft::SharePoint::Utilities::PermissionContext PermissionContext { Microsoft::SharePoint::Utilities::PermissionContext get(); void set(Microsoft::SharePoint::Utilities::PermissionContext value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the context in which to evaluate the permissions of this object.
Docs.value: The PermissionContext representing the context in which the permissions should be evaluated.

remarks.para: Certain actions, such as Create Page, must be restricted at the site level. Others, such as Edit Page, must be restricted at the level of the current object.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable Property RequiredStates As AuthoringStates

public: virtual property Microsoft::SharePoint::Publishing::WebControls::AuthoringStates RequiredStates { Microsoft::SharePoint::Publishing::WebControls::AuthoringStates get(); void set(Microsoft::SharePoint::Publishing::WebControls::AuthoringStates value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the states required to enable this object in the current context.
Docs.value: The states required for this action to be available.

remarks.para: When this ConsoleNode appears in the user interface, this value determines whether the action is enabled or disabled.
This value overrides that of a referenced when the property is set to false.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::SharePoint::Utilities::PermissionMode RightsMode { Microsoft::SharePoint::Utilities::PermissionMode get(); void set(Microsoft::SharePoint::Utilities::PermissionMode value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets whether all or any properties must be satisfied.
Docs.value: A representing whether all or any rights must be satisfied.

remarks.para: You may want to grant access to a if the user has any one of several rights. In that case, set this property to PermissionMode.Any;.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the place where this object appears in the node order.
Docs.value: An integer representing where this ConsoleNode should appear in the node order.

remarks.para: Every ConsoleNode in a must have a unique Sequence value. The nodes are displayed in order from the lowest value to the highest value.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual int UIVersion { get; set; }
Public Overridable Property UIVersion As Integer
public: virtual property int UIVersion { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.UIVersion : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets an integer that indicates the user interface experience point at which this object is to be displayed.
Docs.value: A value from the set {0, 3, 4}.

remarks.para: The value 4 indicates that this ConsoleNode element is displayed only on the new ribbon based user interface experience.
The value 3 indicates that this element is displayed only on the previous user interface experience.
Finally the value 0 indicates that this element is displayed on all user interface experiences.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets whether this object should use its own display text or that of a referenced object.
Docs.value: A Boolean value representing whether the property of the referenced ConsoleAction should be used in place of the Text property of this ConsoleNode.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool UserHasRights() cil managed
Public Overridable Function UserHasRights () As Boolean
abstract member UserHasRights : unit -> bool override this.UserHasRights : unit -> bool

Docs.summary: Determines whether the current user has rights to view this ConsoleNode object.
Docs.returns: A Boolean value representing whether this ConsoleNode should be available to the current user.

remarks.para: If the user's rights can be defined on the basis of a bitwise AND of the object, you should not need to override this method. In contrast, you can specify any logic you need in this method call.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Microsoft.SharePoint.SPBasePermissions UserRights { get; set; }
Public Overridable Property UserRights As SPBasePermissions
public: virtual property Microsoft::SharePoint::SPBasePermissions UserRights { Microsoft::SharePoint::SPBasePermissions get(); void set(Microsoft::SharePoint::SPBasePermissions value); };
member this.UserRights : Microsoft.SharePoint.SPBasePermissions with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the rights required for this user to see this object.
Docs.value: The object's rights mask representing the required rights.This value overrides that of a referenced when the property is set to false.

remarks.para: When the current user does not have these specified rights, this ConsoleNode object does not appear in the user interface.

This UserRights property indicates the list of permissions for the given object, but it is used in conjunction with the property RightsMode may be set to any or all. If RightsMode is set to any, the ConsoleAction shows if the user has any one of the permissions in this property.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool Visible { get; set; }
Public Overridable Property Visible As Boolean
public: virtual property bool Visible { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.Visible : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Specifies whether the should be displayed to the user.
Docs.value: A Boolean value representing whether this ConsoleNode should be visible to the current user.

remarks.para: You should not set this property directly. Whether the node is visible is determined dynamically by the ConsoleDataSource object while it is evaluating the current context.
If the referenced exists, its value always overrides anything set on the ConsoleNode object.
